fullText: Blanchett is magnificent in this adaptation of Chekhov's first play, but the production around her feels uncertain and overwrought.

bwwExcerpt: ... if the politics of this Platonov revamp are apt enough, the drama still founders on the play's inability to link them convincingly to the nearly farcical social comedy of individuals at loose ends.
